did.abstract: Fragments of a deed dated 1684, presumably from the Hempstead, Long Island area.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Wayland Jefferson through Harold R. Heiss, 1960.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Wayland Jefferson (1883-1961) was the town of Southold's first official historian, a post he held from 1931 until his death in 1961. He authored the book "Southold and Its People in Revolutionary Days."

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: A handwritten transcription created by the donor is in the accession file and available to researchers upon request.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Town of Hempstead deed, 1978.135, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This item is in fragments and has been pressed between two pieces of glass for preservation. It is unknown when this measure was taken, but it was prior to a collection assessment conducted in 1996-1997. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Fragments of a deed dated 1684, presumably from the Hempstead, Long Island area, as it is signed by a "Hempstead Town Clerk," though mentioned is also made of Southold, Long Island. Some of the names mentioned appear to be John Clark, John Conklin, Thomas Osman, George Porter, and Thomas Major. The document also mentions "Indians."
